pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.2: At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had transferred a robe to a monk who was his brother’s student. He then used that robe without that monk having relinquished it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.4: “Venerable Upananada is using a robe that he had transferred to me, even though I have not relinquished it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.5: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.7: “How can Venerable Upananda use a robe that he had transferred to another monk, when that monk has not relinquished it?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.8: “Is it true, Upananda, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.11: Foolish man, how can you use a robe that you had transferred to another monk, when he has not relinquished it?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.12: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.13: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.14: ‘If a monk himself transfers robe-cloth to another monk, to a nun, to a trainee nun, to a novice monk, or to a novice nun, and he then uses it without it first being relinquished, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.9: she has been given the full ordination by both Orders.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.11: one training for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.13: a male training in the ten training rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.15: a female training in the ten training rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.19: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.21: there are two kinds of transfer: transfer face-to-face and transfer in the absence of.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.24: one should say, “I transfer this robe-cloth to you/to so-and-so.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.26: one should say, “I give this robe-cloth to you for the purpose of transfer.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.27: The other should ask, “Who is your friend or companion?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.30: The other should say, “I give it to them. Please use their property, give it away, or do as you like with it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.33: if it is not given to him or he uses it without taking it on trust, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.1: If it has not been relinquished, and he perceives that it has not, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.2: If it has not been relinquished, but he is unsure of it, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.3: If it has not been relinquished, but he perceives that it has, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.4: If he determines it or gives it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.5: If it has been relinquished, but he perceives that it has not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.6: If it has been relinquished, but he is unsure if it has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.7: If it has been relinquished, and he perceives that it has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.3: The ninth rule, the training rule on transfers, is finished.
